title: BBC Local Live: Leeds and West Yorkshire on Friday 4 November 2016 - BBC News
summary: prison for man who controlled woman 's life .
leeds east airport faces delays after licensing issue .
charity bonfire torched early by yobs .

documents.title: five things that happened today
text: that 's it from me for today , we 'll return on monday with more news , travel , weather and sport from 08:00 .
before i go , let 's have a look back at the five big stories from today
see you next week !
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: weather : cold night ahead
text: there will be a further showers through the evening and overnight with a strengthening wind .
clear spells in between the showers with lows of 3c ( 38f ) .
it will be a windy day tomorrow with a mixture of sunny spells and scattered showers , especially across central and eastern parts .
it will feel cold in a strong north-easterly wind .
highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

text: ex-serviceman admits cancer lie fraud

documents.title: travel update : problems on m62 westbound
text: just a quick check back on the m62 westbound situation , we 're now down to 20 minute delays and seven miles worth of queues .
all lanes are now open and it seems the to be flowing a bit more easily .
i 'd still avoid if you can .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: cancer fraudster pleads guilty
text: a former soldier from leeds who pretended to have cancer and raised thousands of pounds by taking part in charity events has pleased guilty at his trial .
leeds crown court heard simon buckden , who ran several marathons , including in aid of help for heroes , said he had been diagnosed with cancer in an attempt to get sympathy and money .
but his medical records showed that this was n't true .
buckden had never received a cancer diagnosis or received any treatment or therapy for the disease .
he told a number of people he carried out tours of duty in bosnia , northern ireland , rwanda and both gulf wars .
but his military records revealed he was a military clerk in the army until his discharge in 2001 , and that he only carried out one deployment to bosnia , never serving on the front-line .
he also claimed he suffered with post traumatic stress disorder ( ptsd ) as a result .

documents.title: domestic abuser 'made ex play chess '
text: domestic abuser 'made ex play chess '

documents.title: dather vader to visit leeds for bbc children in need
text: if you see dath vader walking through west yorkshire at the weekend , do n't worry we are n't about to be invaded by the empire .
it 's actually a man called gavin harrison from pudsey who 's walking from coldstream in scotland to the bbc television studios in london for bbc children in need .
gavin says it should take him two weeks in total to make the 400-mile journey .
on sunday he 'll be walking from leeds to wakefield , and is visiting one of the children 's wards at lgi .
he seems to have made a few friends along the way too :

text: nobody wants to spend their friday night sitting on the m62 , so if you 're reading this stuck in the queue all i can tell you is that it was a four car accident which has caused around 13-miles of tailbacks .
there are plenty of tweets about the delays , most of which are a bit rude , so i ca n't show you them .
however , i think `` cleopatra '' sums it up pretty well in three words :

documents.title: breakingrbs branch robbed in leeds city centre
text: more on the incident at the leeds city centre branch of rbs on park row .
west yorkshire police say that a robbery has taken place at the branch .
armed police and the police dogs unit attended the scene , with the branch was closed for a time .
it appears to have since reopened .
i turned up but the doors were locked .
there were a couple of us who tried the doors and rang the doorbell .
a female member of staff showed up and was let in by another female member of staff who told her to 'be as quick as possible ' .
the staff member said they were having 'technical difficulties ' .
she looked really quite stressed . ''

documents.title: breakingincident at rbs in leeds
text: we 've been getting reports of an incident at a branch of rbs in leeds city centre .
the branch on park row is currently closed .
we 'll bring you more as we get it .

text: we 've got severe delays on the m62 westbound this afternoon .
there 's one lane closed with queuing traffic between j25 ( a644 brighouse ) and j24 ( a629 ainley top ) , because of an accident .
travel time is 90 minutes .
there 's 11-miles of congestion stretching to j27 , m621 ( gildersome ) .
this is j25 :
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: rio heroes to switch on leeds christmas lights
text: we 're in november , as i 'm sure you 've noticed , which means that christmas is very much around the corner and soon our towns and cities will be adorned with festive lights .
but as always a bit of pomp and ceremony is needed before they 're turned on , and leeds city council have just announced who be turning them on in the city .
triathletes ali and jonny brownlee and paralympian kadeena cox will be doing the honours next thursday on victoria gardens from 18:45 .
the switch-on will also include live music and entertainment in front of an expected crowd of thousands .
the people of leeds have given us so much support and encouragement through the years and knowing the city is behind us has always helped spur us on whenever we 're competing around the world . ''

documents.title: owain thanks bbc weather watchers
text: our weather presenter owain is celebrating one year of bbc weather watchers - which sees hundreds of people every day sending in their weather shots from around our region .
he wants to say a very big `` thank you '' to everybody who 's taken part so far
here 's @ twitterid chatting about why weather watchers content is so important .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: fiancee 's heartfelt tribute after halifax man 'died in her arms ' on plane
text: a grieving fiancee has paid a heartfelt tribute to her partner after he tragically died in her arms on the plane home from the trip of a lifetime - one day after they got engaged .
author: Halifax Courier

documents.title: latest from flood-damaged bridge
text: these are the latest from linton bridge near wetherby whch has been closed since 27 december , following damage to it in the boxing day floods .
a temporary arch support system is being installed so that engineers can work under the bridge so that cracks can be fixed and heavy machinery can be bought onto it .

the bridge is a grade 2 listed structure the work has to be sympathetic to its original design , which means that in order to strengthen it they will have to drive concrete posts into its abutments ( they 're the bits that go from the top into the water ) .
the bridge is expected to open next summer .

documents.title: abbey dash will close roads this weekend
text: this sunday runners will be taking part in the age uk leeds abbey dash where thousands will be running the 10k course through the streets of leeds .
the race starts at 10:00 and will mean that parts of wellington street , the headrow and kirkstall road will be closed .
click here to have a look at the bus routes affected .

documents.title: prison for man who controlled woman 's life
text: a man 's been given a four-year jail sentence after becoming the first person in west yorkshire to be convicted of the new charge of `` controlling and coercive behaviour '' .
bradford crown court heard that graham o'shea , 42 , of mixenden , took over every aspect of his victim 's life after moving into her home in halifax .
in one bizarre incident he made her learn chess .
he would select a piece on the board telling her that `` if it was the last one left on the board she would be leaving in a black box . ''
he also :
she eventually escaped him when she lied about going to work and instead too the bus to her father 's home so she could tell police about her ordeal .
i would like to praise the bravery and courage shown by the victim in this case , in not only finding the strength to come forward , but in giving her evidence in court .
i hope that the conviction goes some way to bringing her some closure , and that she can move on with her life . ''

documents.title: have your say on transport in leeds
text: if you 've been getting annoyed trying to travel around leeds because of the jams and roadworks , then this is an opportunity to vent your spleen .
leeds city council has been running a survey to ask people what they think about the city 's transport network , and it 's now in its last week .
so do n't just sit there fuming , get filling out the survey !

documents.title: second arrest in 'mad max ' bikers chaos
text: second arrest in 'mad max ' bikers chaos

documents.title: listen : yorkshire ukip mep blasts high court 's article 50 ruling
text: the brexit process has been thrown into chaos after the high court ruled that theresa may does n't have the legal power to trigger it .
instead , the judges said it 's up to parliament to decide on beginning the formal leaving procedure , known as article 50 .
it means mps and peers could either block brexit or delay it .
mike hookem , ukip mep for yorkshire and north lincolnshire , has told bbc radio humberside he is n't happy about the ruling :

documents.title: leeds sign aston from sheffield
text: leeds sign aston from sheffield

documents.title: women of the world festival starts today
text: the 'women of the world ' festival starts in bradford today - aimed at celebrating female achievements and discussing serious issues surrounding gender politics .
nobel peace prize winner malala yousafzai is one of the speakers at bradford cathedral tomorrow
she was persuaded to attend by a group of teenagers from the city :
they made a video and begged her to come to bradford , i remember editing it on a phone trying to make it look snazzy and we thought that there 's no way she would actually come .
a week or two later we get an email saying malala loved the video and she 's coming ! ''

documents.title: police appeal over 'body-slamming '
text: west yorkshire police have confirmed they 're investigating a case of `` body-slamming '' where people throw themselves at the windscreens of parked cars to try to smash them .
they 're appealing for witnesses after an incident when the front window of a car was broken in hall lane at armley in leeds on sunday .
police say they 're aware of comments about the craze on social media - and want people to contact them if they 've been a victim .
crazes have come thick and fast in recent years fuelled by social media .
there have been the positive side including series of events such as the ice bucket challenge but there have also been others which have been more dangerous - including neknominate craze .

documents.title: charity bonfire torched early by yobs
text: a charity bonfire night was almost ruined when yobs set fire to wood that a pub had collected for tomorrow night .
the landlord and lady of the jack o'mitre pub in scammonden , huddersfield , say someone came along and torched the bonfire at around 01:00 today .
they are holding a guy fawkes ' night event tomorrow night in aid of the forget me not children 's hos
but all is not lost , thanks to the generous nature of people living around them , they have had plenty of donations of fresh wood for tomorrow night 's bonfire .
everyone 's rallying around , a local pallet company has donated three truck loads of wood .
we 've had calls from various other companies offering wood from 07:30 this morning . ''
here 's a view of the fire taken earlier this morning from some distance away :

documents.title: travel : leeds inner ring road problems
text: we 've got one lane blocked on the a58 ( m ) inner ring road eastbound in leeds at the a58 wellington road junction , because of a broken down car .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: in autumn in west yorkshire
text: can you believe that the bbc weather watchers website is celebrating its first birthday today ?
we 've had some great from you over the last year , so i thought i 'd use it as an excuse to share some more great autumnal with you
this is chellow dean in bradford , just check out all of those colours !
there are n't many leaves left on these trees in horsforth
but plenty still in low ackworth

documents.title: leeds east airport faces delays after licencing issue
text: it 's been revealed that plans for new flight routes from leeds east airport will not get the go-ahead next year .
leeds east airport at church fenton , a former raf base , says that they need an additional license which wo n't come through on time .
the airport had planned to offer up to four charter flights a day to cannes , faro and malaga from may 2017 .
they promised a `` first class vip business experience '' , with a return ticket costing around £ 1,000 .

documents.title: mcshane signs castleford extension
text: mcshane signs castleford extension

documents.title: dewsbury museum will close this weekend
text: just over a month after deciding to start closing museums , kirklees council will shut its first site this weekend .
dewsbury museum will shut for good on sunday , making it the first of three to stop admitting the public .
the musuem in crow nest park , the red house museum in gomersal and huddersfield 's tolson museum are all going as kirklees desperately tries to save money .
but the closing date for the dewsbury site was only announced yesterday while officials also declared that the red house 's last day of business with be 21 december .
kirklees council 's closure plan will save it £ 531,000 although it has pledged to replace the tolson museum with a new building somewhere within huddersfield when that eventually closes .

documents.title: weather : another cold day with chance of showers
text: there will be some bright and sunny spells through the day as well as a few showers .
one or two of the showers could be on the heavy side during the afternoon .
highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : our live coverage
text: hello and welcome to your live feed of news , sport , weather and travel in west yorkshire for friday !
nothing out of the ordinary to tell you about on the roads this morning , it 's busy in all the usual pinch points but nothing that should slow you down too much .
as for the weather , here it is in three words : cold and wet .
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Leeds
